item.title: Causal Inference in Data Science
item.description: “Causation […] is the cement of the universe.” — David Hume, Abstract Why Ask Why? We can’t help but think about causation As a cognitive scientist, I study common sense causal reasoning. Folks say “correlation is not causation” like a broken record, yet we can’t help but think “leaves fall because the wind blows”, not “leaves happen to fall after the wind blows”. If you’re intrigued by causal cognition, I recommend this talk by Tobias Gerstenberg .
